title: Design Library Essentials
content:
I need to beef up my design library. What are some of the best titles out there? I am particularly interested in [books](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906113710/http:/typophile.com/wiki/faq%252Bbooks) on typography.

 [‹ Malaga and other options](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906113710/http:/typophile.com/node/37731 "Go to previous forum topic") [How to Create Modular Scales ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906113710/http:/typophile.com/node/37726 "Go to next forum topic")
author: julia.warren

comments.content: The Elements of Typographic Design, Anatomy of a Typeface, Designing Type, Letters of Credit, Logo, Font & Lettering Bible, Thinking with Type. To name a few.

I posted a similar question [here.](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906113710/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37674)

I personally love [TYPO](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906113710/http:/fr.bookbutler.com/do/bookSearch;jsessionid=CC334739F9F432BA2D10078096DD6ABD?pageNr=1&showMore=true&sortBy=salesrank&searchFor=3895084735&searchBy=isbn&searchIn=uk&shipTo=gb&amountIn=gbp&zip=) by Friedl, Ott & Stein, to say it’s coffee table is understating the obvious. It’s a beautifully designed book. I took a quick snap [here.](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906113710/http:/www.n3rt.com/pub/typo.jpg)

Google books on typography in my opinion...  
Also, check out Magma Books, a store in London...  
They always have a stash of real nice books...

x
